playbook_rules.rule_text: If a player's ACWR exceeds 1.5 for two or more consecutive weeks, implement a mandatory load reduction of at least 20% in the following training week. Prioritize technical low-intensity sessions.
Optimal ACWR range is 0.8 to 1.3. A ratio below 0.8 indicates undertraining, which increases injury risk equally. If ACWR < 0.8, gradually increase load by no more than 10% per week.

For wingers and fullbacks: if sprint distance in a match week exceeds the 4-week rolling average by more than 20%, limit Match Day Minus 2 (MD-2) technical drill intensity. This position group is at highest risk for hamstring and adductor strains.
If a winger has started 3 or more consecutive 90-minute matches, they must have at least one full rest day (no technical training) before the next fixture, regardless of ACWR score.

For centre-backs: heading load (if available) and aerial duel count contribute to neck and lumbar strain. If aerial duels exceed 12 per match for two consecutive games, prescribe a neck mobility and lumbar stability session.
Strikers with high sprint acceleration counts (>20 sprints) who play >75 minutes are at elevated risk of hip flexor and adductor strain. Cap MD-1 intensity to 40% of normal session.

For goalkeepers: diving and rapid lateral movement sessions should be limited to 45 minutes if they follow two or more consecutive high-intensity match days. Shoulder and knee joint health indicators should be monitored post-session.

If training monotony exceeds 2.0 for more than 5 consecutive days, the training programme must be varied. Introduce one active recovery or sport-specific drill variety session to break the monotony cycle and prevent overreaching syndrome.

High monotony (>2.5) combined with a strain score above 1500 arbitrary units (AU) should trigger a full rest day or pool recovery session the following day. Do not schedule technical or physical sessions on this day.

Players returning from international duty (especially across more than 3 time zones) should be granted a 48-hour acclimatisation window. Training load in the first week back must not exceed 80% of their pre-international week baseline.

During periods with more than 3 fixtures in 10 days, rotate at least 3-4 players per match to distribute workload. Prioritize players with ACWR > 1.3 for rotation. Core squad members should not start more than 2 consecutive matches during congested periods.

If a player's readiness score drops below 40 on the morning of a match day, escalate to the medical team. Avoid starting the player unless squad depth is critically low. A readiness below 30 is an automatic non-start recommendation.

After any match where a player exceeds 85 minutes of play at high intensity, a mandatory active recovery protocol (pool session, bike flush, or cold therapy + compression) is required within 24 hours of the final whistle.

If a player self-reports sleep quality of less than 5/10 for more than 2 consecutive nights, notify the performance psychologist. Poor sleep elevates injury risk equivalent to a 25% ACWR spike. Reduce training contact load accordingly.

Players under 21 years of age have a lower chronic load baseline due to development stage. Their ACWR thresholds should be tightened: flag at 1.3 (vs 1.5 for senior players) and hard cap at 60 minutes per match during congested schedules.

historical_cases.intervention: Reduced MD-2 sprint drills by 30%. Substituted at 72 min in next fixture.
historical_cases.outcome: Player reported minor tightness but completed the season without muscular injury. No Grade 1 or above strain recorded.

historical_cases.intervention: No load reduction applied. Player started full 90 in next match.
historical_cases.outcome: Grade 1 hamstring strain sustained in the 68th minute. Player out for 3 weeks.

drivers: Consecutive MD-1 and MD-2 high-intensity sessions

historical_cases.intervention: Full rest day inserted. Substituted at 60 min in next fixture. Pool recovery session on MD+1.
historical_cases.outcome: Readiness score recovered to 68 within 5 days. No injury. Player returned to full training.

drivers: No full rest day in the past 8 days

historical_cases.intervention: None applied (medical team not alerted in time).
historical_cases.outcome: Calf strain in training 2 days later. 2-week absence. Recommended action in hindsight: mandatory rest day after 3rd match in 8 days.

drivers: Hip flexor tightness flagged by physio

historical_cases.intervention: MD-1 session capped at 45 minutes. Targeted hip flexor mobility work prescribed. Started full 90 in next match.
historical_cases.outcome: No injury. Physio cleared player after targeted mobility session. Player performance maintained.

historical_cases.topic: International Break Return — Load Spike Avoided
historical_cases.intervention: 48-hour acclimatisation window applied. First week back capped at 80% of pre-international load.
historical_cases.outcome: Player integrated smoothly. No injury. First match back: 60 minutes with no adverse effects reported.

historical_cases.intervention: Player subbed at 60 min in next match. Returned to U21 squad for one midweek match to maintain rhythm at lower intensity.
historical_cases.outcome: Risk score reduced to 48 the following week. No injury. Readiness recovered to 71.
